page.title: 01North Newton Hill Lochranza
page.content: Rugged Hill country. Unfenced grazing for sheep and deer. Coastal strip of land between sea dn cliffs and steep slopes uncultivated. Houses occur along Loch edge in Lochranza and at south Newton above Loch. No industry except tourism, sheep farming and deer stalking car ferry to Kintyre important link with west coast scotland operates out of Lochranza. During summer months only. Pleasure boats use Loch and sea intensely, very good area to see seals, birds of prey, deer, wild flowers etc. This area also used for gologicl and geographicl studies. 12 houses in aea. Only 5 occupied permanently. Others are holiday homes.Recent find of cup marked stone above South Newton points to bronze age occupation in area 'The Whins' workshop, South Newton. (handpainted stone beach pebbles of
